card.title: Schweizer Gletscher: Vergleichsbilder – Früher und Heute
card.description: Das Hauptziel meiner letzjährigen, spätsommerlichen, Schweizreise war der Besuch der schwindenden Eisriesen, meine Sehnsucht nach schmelzenden Gletschern. Dabei schwingt eine gehörige Portion Melan…

descendants.content:
@frauxirah @ClimateNewsNow
No, you are missing the point I was making. The older picture has a much narrower field of view than the more recent one by roughly 50%. The rocks on the far left in the first are to our right of the man's head in the second. The upper reaches of the glacier are not greatly reduced in width than before however the head has greatly retreated.
(Re angles just overlay the line of the railing footing and the difference is very clear.)

descendants.content:
@AlisonW OK, we obviously don't talk about the same thing. Yes, angles are different, but no, it doesn't matter because:
"Switzerland has lost one-third of its glacier volume since 2000, according to official statistics, and 10% has disappeared in the last two years alone."
Let's agree to disagree.
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/article/2024/aug/06/it-made-me-cry-photos-taken-15-years-apart-show-melting-swiss-glaciers?CMP=Share_AndroidApp_Other
